Comments_List:
1. How to conduct research ethically and morally right.
2. The procedure to apply for a patent, submitting paper and reviewing paper. 
3. Some case studying judging whether some actions are right.
The ethical and legal aspects of doing research, including when to take action and what sorts of malpractices to avoid.
How to conduct the research appropriately
The ethics of conducting scientific research.
How to avoid misconduct.
Learn a lot of things that relate to the responsible conduct of research.
Most useful information was probably the patent stuff
Not much. Except to learn more about how yale patents things.
Basic knowledge about doing research in a responsible manner.
Some knowledge of ethics, patents, etc.
I gained knowledge on intellectual property, fair advisor-student expectations, and the overall ethics of research.

Basics of patents
Responsible conduct pertaining to plagiarism, correctly citing papers, methodology of experimental process

The lectures are given by DGS and they are very professional. 
In the last lecture, the course is given interactively, so students can think and talk about what they believe. 
However, the lectures could made to be more interesting.
Could probably be made a bit more interactive, possibly focusing on case studies.
The contens were good. Maybe students could be more engaged.
great
Important course for incoming graduate students.
It's a required ethics course, so it's about what one would expect
The professors ranged from being very prepared to not prepared. Maybe have the coffee we were promised.
There should be more activities or breaks or something so that it's not just 2 straight hours of following a powerpoint.
The first two sessions could have had more interactive activities to keep more engagement.
Yes because students have to know these stuff in the course of doing academic research
Sure, everyone who work in the science fields should take this course.
Great, really necessary for graduate students
Yes! It's something that can't learn from the textbook. Very helpful.
Yes. it reminds us the way to do research. Things which we should be aware of yet are not taught elsewhere are well summarized and taught in this course.
Yes, it's mandatory
It is essential for anyone planning to do research.
Yes, as it is good background information on some of the conduct expected from us as PhD students.
